This is a remote opportunity in the UK.

What we're looking for:

  • Must communicate in German fluently both verbally and in written form

  • 0-1+ years of relevant customer-facing experience, preferably in sales or related roles.

  • Demonstrates a genuine interest in a sales career and understanding the sales process. and an eagerness to solve our prospects’ problems.

  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills, possessing the demonstrated ability to: articulate ideas clearly and concisely verbally and in writing, comfortably engage with new people and build rapport over the phone, email, and social media.

  • Has business acumen, having a foundational grasp of how businesses operate, including common challenges and the importance of revenue generation.

  • Proficiency in basic computer applications such as standard office software and demonstrates an aptitude for learning new technology, including CRM systems and sales engagement tools.

  • Resilient, self-motivated, and committed to achieving targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • Curious and coachable, with an ability to embrace and apply feedback, adapt, and continuously improve.

What you can expect:

  • Proactively identify and engage prospects through strategic outbound prospecting activities, including cold calling, email campaigns, and leveraging social selling techniques.

  • Qualify inbound leads generated through marketing efforts, understanding their needs and determining their fit for our solutions.

  • Conduct engaging conversations with prospects to understand their business challenges and effectively communicate the value of our offerings.

  • Diligently research and gather information on target accounts to create strategies for outreach and maximize engagement.

  • Created a qualified pipeline for Account Executives, ensuring a smooth transition in the sales process.

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all activities and prospect interactions within our CRM system to support reporting and pipeline visibility.

  • Regularly collaborate with Account Executives and sales managers to prioritize outreach efforts, seek guidance on best practices, and refine approaches.

  • Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly targets for qualified opportunities generated.

  • Continuously learn about our products, services, and the market landscape to effectively communicate our value proposition.

  • Utilize feedback and tools from coaching sessions to identify improvement areas in calls or emails, proactively refining outreach and objection-handling techniques.

We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.


Our approach to work
We recognize the power of both in person collaboration and remote work. Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

At 1Password, we’re building the foundation for a safe, productive digital future. We innovated the market-leading enterprise password manager and pioneered Extended Access Management, a new cybersecurity category built for the way people and AI agents work today. As one of the most loved brands in cybersecurity, we take a human-centric approach in everything from product strategy to user experience. Over 175,000 businesses and millions of people trust us to provide seamless, secure access to their most critical information. 

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

As a Business Development Representative, you play a pivotal role in driving our sales pipeline. With a strong focus on outbound prospecting, you proactively identify and engage high-potential prospects, while also managing inbound leads. As the first point of contact for current customers and prospects, you lay the foundation for meaningful sales conversations and long-term partnerships.

Expectations of this role

This is designated as an in-office role. You are expected to work from 1Password’s downtown Toronto office on a full-time basis (3-5 days/week).

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

What we're looking for:

(for entry level BDR roles)

  • 0-1+ years of relevant customer-facing experience, preferably in sales or related roles.

  • Demonstrates a genuine interest in a sales career and understanding the sales process. and an eagerness to solve our prospects’ problems

  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills, possessing the demonstrated ability to: articulate ideas clearly and concisely verbally and in writing, comfortably engage with new people and build rapport over the phone, email, and social media.

  • Has business acumen, having a foundational grasp of how businesses operate, including common challenges and the importance of revenue generation.

  • Proficiency in basic computer applications such as standard office software and demonstrates an aptitude for learning new technology, including CRM systems and sales engagement tools.

  • Resilient, self-motivated, and committed to achieving targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • Curious and coachable, with an ability to embrace and apply feedback, adapt, and continuously improve.

(for BDRs with experience)

  • 2+ years of successful customer-facing experience, with a demonstrable track record in outbound sales, lead generation, or a related role.

  • Possesses a solid understanding of the sales process and a proven ability to proactively identify prospect needs and articulate solutions effectively.

  • Exhibits highly effective communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to: articulate value propositions clearly and persuasively across various channels (verbal, written, social), confidently engage and build rapport with prospects, and effectively navigate initial objections.

  • Displays solid business acumen, understanding how businesses operate, their strategic priorities, and the direct impact of security solutions on their success and revenue generation.

  • Proficient in utilizing a range of technology, including CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), sales engagement tools, and relevant business software to optimize outreach and track progress. Demonstrates the ability to quickly adopt and leverage new sales technologies.

  • Highly resilient, self-driven, and consistently achieves and/or exceeds targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • Curious and actively seeks coaching to further refine sales techniques and product knowledge. Demonstrates a strong ability to apply feedback quickly and adapt strategies for continuous improvement.

What you can expect:

  • Proactively identify and engage prospects through strategic outbound prospecting activities, including cold calling, email campaigns, and leveraging social selling techniques.

  • Qualify inbound leads generated through marketing efforts, understanding their needs and determining their fit for our solutions.

  • Conduct engaging conversations with prospects to understand their business challenges and effectively communicate the value of our offerings.

  • Diligently research and gather information on target accounts to create strategies for outreach and maximize engagement.

  • Created a qualified pipeline for Account Executives, ensuring a smooth transition in the sales process.

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all activities and prospect interactions within our CRM system to support reporting and pipeline visibility.

  • Regularly collaborate with Account Executives and sales managers to prioritize outreach efforts, seek guidance on best practices, and refine approaches.

  • Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly targets for qualified opportunities generated.

  • Continuously learn about our products, services, and the market landscape to effectively communicate our value proposition.

  • Utilize feedback and tools from coaching sessions to identify improvement areas in calls or emails, proactively refining outreach and objection-handling techniques.

Canada-based roles only: The annual base salary for the entry-level Business Development Representative, SMB role is between $57,000 CAD and $77,000 CAD and is commission-eligible. This role is also eligible for immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

Canada-based roles only: The annual base salary for the Business Development Representative Commercial and Enterprise roles is between $65,000 CAD and $87,000 CAD and is commission-eligible. This role is also eligible for immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.

Our culture

At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results.

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to work
We recognize the power of both in person collaboration and remote work. Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

Health and wellbeing

👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs

jobs.title: Business Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About 1Password

At 1Password, we’re building the foundation for a safe, productive digital future. Our mission is to unleash employee productivity without compromising security by ensuring every identity is authentic, every application sign-in is secure, and every device is trusted. We innovated the market-leading enterprise password manager and pioneered Extended Access Management, a new cybersecurity category built for the way people and AI agents work today. As one of the most loved brands in cybersecurity, we take a human-centric approach in everything from product strategy to user experience. Over 175,000 businesses and millions of people trust us to provide seamless, secure access to their most critical information. 

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

As a Business Development Representative, you play a pivotal role in driving our sales pipeline. With a strong focus on outbound prospecting, you proactively identify and engage high-potential prospects, while also managing inbound leads. As the first point of contact for current customers and prospects, you lay the foundation for meaningful sales conversations and long-term partnerships.

Expectations of this role

While currently designated as a remote role, this role will eventually be designated as an in-office role based out of Austin. You will be expected to work from 1Password’s Austin location on a full-time basis (3-5 days/week).

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

What we're looking for:

(for entry level BDR roles)

  • 0-1+ years of relevant customer-facing experience, preferably in sales or related roles.

  • Demonstrates a genuine interest in a sales career and understanding the sales process. and an eagerness to solve our prospects’ problems

  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills, possessing the demonstrated ability to: articulate ideas clearly and concisely verbally and in writing, comfortably engage with new people and build rapport over the phone, email, and social media.

  • Has business acumen, having a foundational grasp of how businesses operate, including common challenges and the importance of revenue generation.

  • Proficiency in basic computer applications such as standard office software and demonstrates an aptitude for learning new technology, including CRM systems and sales engagement tools.

  • Resilient, self-motivated, and committed to achieving targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • Curious and coachable, with an ability to embrace and apply feedback, adapt, and continuously improve.

(for BDRs with experience)

  • 2+ years of successful customer-facing experience, with a demonstrable track record in outbound sales, lead generation, or a related role.

  • Possesses a solid understanding of the sales process and a proven ability to proactively identify prospect needs and articulate solutions effectively.

  • Exhibits highly effective communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to: articulate value propositions clearly and persuasively across various channels (verbal, written, social), confidently engage and build rapport with prospects, and effectively navigate initial objections.

  • Displays solid business acumen, understanding how businesses operate, their strategic priorities, and the direct impact of security solutions on their success and revenue generation.

  • Proficient in utilizing a range of technology, including CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), sales engagement tools, and relevant business software to optimize outreach and track progress. Demonstrates the ability to quickly adopt and leverage new sales technologies.

  • Highly resilient, self-driven, and consistently achieves and/or exceeds targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • Curious and actively seeks coaching to further refine sales techniques and product knowledge. Demonstrates a strong ability to apply feedback quickly and adapt strategies for continuous improvement.

What you can expect:

  • Proactively identify and engage prospects through strategic outbound prospecting activities, including cold calling, email campaigns, and leveraging social selling techniques.

  • Qualify inbound leads generated through marketing efforts, understanding their needs and determining their fit for our solutions.

  • Conduct engaging conversations with prospects to understand their business challenges and effectively communicate the value of our offerings.

  • Diligently research and gather information on target accounts to create strategies for outreach and maximize engagement.

  • Created a qualified pipeline for Account Executives, ensuring a smooth transition in the sales process.

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all activities and prospect interactions within our CRM system to support reporting and pipeline visibility.

  • Regularly collaborate with Account Executives and sales managers to prioritize outreach efforts, seek guidance on best practices, and refine approaches.

  • Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly targets for qualified opportunities generated.

  • Continuously learn about our products, services, and the market landscape to effectively communicate our value proposition.

  • Utilize feedback and tools from coaching sessions to identify improvement areas in calls or emails, proactively refining outreach and objection-handling techniques.

USA-based roles only: The annual base salary for the entry-level Business Development Representative, SMB role is between $54,000 USD and $72,000 USD and is commission-eligible. The role is also eligible for immediate participation in 1Password's benefits program (health, dental, 401k and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

USA-based roles only: The annual base salary for the Business Development Representative Commercial and Enterprise roles is between $61,000 USD and $83,000 USD and is commission-eligible. The role is also eligible for immediate participation in 1Password's benefits program (health, dental, 401k and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.

Our culture

At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results.

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to work
We recognize the power of both in person collaboration and remote work. Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.
For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

What we offer

We believe in working hard, and rewarding that hard work through our benefits. While not an exhaustive list, here is a glance at what we currently offer:

Health and wellbeing

👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs

🏝 Generous PTO policy

💖 Four company-wide wellness days

Growth and future

📈 Company equity for all full-time employees

💸 Retirement matching program

🔑 Free 1Password account

Community

🤝 Paid volunteer days

🌎 Employee-led inclusion and belonging programs and ERGs

🏆 Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly

You belong here.

1Password is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that is built on trust, support and respect. We welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, sex, citizenship, education, languages spoken or veteran status. Be yourself, find your people and share the things you love.

Accommodation is available upon request at any point during our recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please speak to your talent acquisition partner or email us at nextbit@agilebits.com and we’ll work to meet your needs.

Remote work is a part of our DNA. Given that our company was founded remotely in 2005, we can safely say we're experts at building remote culture. That said, remote work at 1Password does mean working from your home country. If you've got questions or concerns about this, your talent partner would be happy to address them with you.

Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check that may consist of prior employment verification, reference checks, education confirmation, criminal background, publicly available social media, credit history, or other information, as permitted by local law.

1Password uses artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies, including natural language processing and predictive analytics, to assist in the initial screening of employment applications and improve our recruitment process. See here for the latest third party bias audit information. If you prefer not to have your application assessed using AI/ML features, you may opt out by completing this form. For additional information see our Candidate Privacy Notice.

  • Strong foundation in security fundamentals and authentication/authorization flows.

  • Experience collaborating across product and security teams to design secure workflows.

  • Proficiency in Golang or Rust.

Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

As an Account Executive, you manage a territory that includes target-accounts and an existing book of business with companies up to 1,000 employees. Your primary focus is hunting new business opportunities, building sales pipeline, and driving growth within the SMB sector. You are also responsible for upselling into the existing account base, leveraging our Extended Access Management platform. You will own a specific geographical region or country within the EMEA market.

This is a remote opportunity within the UK.

What we're looking for:

  • 2+ years of SaaS sales experience, preferably in security with a focus on SMB or Mid Market accounts OR a top performing BDR with outbound experience and success ready to step up.

  • Experience owning a geographical territory or country within EMEA.

  • Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quotas and KPIs.

  • Experience upselling & cross-selling to both new customers and across a book of business

  • Solid skills in:

    • Prospecting, pipeline building, account planning, value-based selling, and territory management, with effective operating rigor in pipeline management, forecasting, and pacing to target

    • Business acumen, solution selling, negotiation, & presenting to company decision makers/stakeholders

    • Written and verbal communication skills across email and communication tools such as Slack, and Zoom, with the ability to make technical concepts accessible to non-technical parties.

  • Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex cybersecurity concepts, particularly in Identity and Access Management.

  • Resilient, self-motivated, and committed to achieving targets while thriving in a remote environment.

  • A proven team player, eager to collaborate and achieve shared goals rather than working in isolation.

  • Curious and coachable, with a proven ability to apply feedback, adapt, and continuously improve.

  • Preferred: Proficiency with Salesforce, Slack, Zoom, Linkedin Sales Navigator & Outreach

  • Willingness to travel within your region for client meetings and industry events.

  • Nice to have if you can communicate in either of these languages fluently (French, Italian or Spanish)

What you can expect:

  • Own Your Territory: Manage and grow your designated geographical region or country within EMEA, focusing on acquiring new SMB clients and expanding existing accounts.

  • Manage Pipeline: Build and maintain a healthy sales pipeline through proactive prospecting, inbound leads, cold calling, and networking, utilizing our formalized sales process, MEDDPPICC.

  • Drive New Business Growth: Achieve or exceed sales targets and KPIs by:

    • Consistently meeting or exceeding monthly/quarterly sales quotas.

    • Maintaining a high level of outbound activity, including calls, emails, and meetings.

    • Developing and closing new business opportunities within your territory.

  • Drive Organic Growth: Identify opportunities to upsell 1Password solutions within existing accounts, leveraging your understanding of Extended Access Management.

  • Engage the Industry: Attend industry events, trade shows, and conferences to represent 1Password, build brand presence, and network with potential customers

  • Stay Informed: Stay up to date on cybersecurity trends and developments, particularly in Identity and Access Management, to effectively position 1Password solutions and communicate their value to prospects.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally:

    • Build collaborative relationships with internal teams (e.g. BDR, Solutions, Channels, Onboarding, Customer Success) to optimize client engagement and identify growth opportunities.

    • Engage in multi-threaded relationships within client organizations to enhance overall account health.

  • Focus on Solution Selling:

    • Implement selling strategies to align our solutions with client needs and objectives.

    • Demonstrate a deep understanding of client pain points and position our offerings as strategic solutions.

  • Present and Negotiate:

    • Confidently present to company decision makers/stakeholders, articulating the value proposition of our products and services.

    • Create mutual action plans to align the sales team and prospects on responsibilities, steps and timelines for closing deals.

    • Utilize effective negotiation skills to drive mutually beneficial outcomes.

Our culture 
At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first. 

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results. 

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to work
We recognize the power of both in person collaboration and remote work. Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

What we offer
We believe in working hard, and rewarding that hard work through our benefits. While not an exhaustive list, here is a glance at what we currently offer: 

Health and wellbeing
👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs
🏝 Generous PTO policy 
💖 Four company-wide wellness days 

 Growth and future 
📈 Company equity for all full-time employees
💸 Retirement matching program

Community 
🤝 Paid volunteer days 
🌎 Employee-led inclusion and belonging programs and ERGs

  • Domain Expertise: A strong background in cybersecurity, identity, or related enterprise security software is highly desirable. You must be able to command the respect of C-level technical and business audiences.

  • Executive Presence: World-class communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and align stakeholders across the C-suite, GTM, and Product organizations.

  • Operational Excellence: Strong business and financial acumen, with experience managing departmental budgets, creating data-driven strategies, and linking technical initiatives to financial outcomes.

 - Domain Expertise: A strong background in cybersecurity, identity, or related enterprise security software is highly desirable. You must be able to command the respect of C-level technical and business audiences.

 - Executive Presence: World-class communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and align stakeholders across the C-suite, GTM, and Product organizations.

 - Operational Excellence: Strong business and financial acumen, with experience managing departmental budgets, creating data-driven strategies, and linking technical initiatives to financial outcomes.

Our culture

At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results.

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to work

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

We believe in working hard, and rewarding that hard work through our benefits. While not an exhaustive list, here is a glance at what we currently offer:

Health and wellbeing

👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs

🩺 Competitive health benefits

🏝 Generous PTO policy

Growth and future

Community

🤝 Paid volunteer days

🏆 Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly

🌎 Remote-first work environment

This role requires deep technical expertise in distributed systems and the ability to collaborate closely with multiple internal engineering teams.

  • You have proven experience in implementing testing methodologies and debugging techniques to ensure high-quality code

  • You’re adaptable and resilient, thriving in fast-paced environments with shifting priorities

  • Lead the development, testing and debugging of production software systems for new and existing product features. Ensure their successful delivery and provide regular updates to stakeholders.

  • Mentor junior team members by providing technical guidance, sharing best practices, leading training sessions, being a go-to for your team's area of expertise, and empowering them to work more independently over time while providing support and guidance along the way

  • Lead discussions to ensure that technical requirements are clearly communicated and understood. Proactively identify potential technical challenges and propose scalable solutions

  • Lead planning and align goals with the broader project objectives. Own task distribution, provide estimates on the effort required for specific tasks, and ensure work is completed on time

  • Drive technical design, specifications, and implementation of improvements to the performance, accessibility, reliability, and scalability of our technologies

  • Work with cross-functional teams and/or stakeholders to develop effective testing strategies, address issues, and ensure the delivery of high quality products

  • Solve complex technical challenges and provide innovative solutions.

  • Stay informed about the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices in development, and advocate for their integration when relevant.

  • Build new test infrastructures to help other developers build comprehensive tests more effectively and efficiently

  • Set an example in code reviews by evaluating code quality, architectural alignment, performance, security, and adherence to best practices. Provide feedback, explain reasoning, and help team members understand and improve their code.

  • Generate and review documentation on code processes to ensure scalability

  • Be available for on-call rotational work to ensure uninterrupted support and resolve emergencies

  • Design and implement technical integrations that allow our customers to connect seamlessly with 1Password and their favorite software.

  • Join partner calls to architect and troubleshoot integration solutions

jobs.title: Staff Product Designer - AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About 1Password

At 1Password, we’re building the foundation for a safe, productive digital future. Our mission is to unleash employee productivity without compromising security by ensuring every identity is authentic, every application sign-in is secure, and every device is trusted. We innovated the market-leading enterprise password manager and pioneered Extended Access Management, a new cybersecurity category built for the way people and AI agents work today. As one of the most loved brands in cybersecurity, we take a human-centric approach in everything from product strategy to user experience. Over 175,000 businesses and millions of people trust us to provide seamless, secure access to their most critical information. 

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

Our Experience, Design and Research (EDR) team is at the heart of this mission—transforming complex security challenges into elegant, human-centered experiences. We value collaboration, curiosity, and a strong design culture built on customer empathy and innovation.

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

As a Staff Product Designer on AI, you’ll operate as a strategic leader and expert practitioner, shaping the future of our AI product experiences. You’ll define and champion UX vision and strategy for your area of ownership, partnering closely with product and engineering leaders to set direction that balances customer needs, market trends, and business goals.

In this role, you’ll tackle complex, ambiguous problems, leading by example in framing challenges, setting priorities, and using evidence-based insights to drive design decisions. You’ll mentor and coach other designers, elevate our team’s craft, and influence the roadmap at the highest levels of the organization. Your understanding of security principles will guide your design work while keeping the user experience clear, approachable, and trustworthy.

This is a remote opportunity within Canada and the US.

What we're looking for:

  • 8+ years of relevant product design experience, ideally in fast-paced, product-led companies, with staff-level responsibilities and leadership presence.

  • Experience designing AI-powered product features or tooling (e.g., generative AI, ML-powered recommendations, large language models, etc.), or a strong interest and capacity to ramp up quickly in this space.

  • Strong systems thinking: the ability to design for and reason about intelligent systems, user flows with non-deterministic outputs, and complex decision paths.

  • Familiarity with concepts like model transparency, feedback loops, user control, and responsible AI, and how they impact product design.

  • A strong understanding of human-centered design principles, and the ability to apply these even when working with emerging, unpredictable technologies.

  • Experience designing in a cybersecurity context or for privacy-sensitive domains; a commitment to designing secure, trustworthy, and accessible user experiences.

  • A portfolio that demonstrates depth in information architecture, interaction design, prototyping, and visual design, with examples of AI or data-driven features a strong plus.

  • Comfortable navigating ambiguity, defining strategy, and bringing clarity through storytelling, facilitation, and open collaboration.

  • Proven ability to mentor and uplevel other designers, while role-modelling curiosity, resilience, and thoughtful design critique.

  • A growth mindset and a track record of navigating complexity and change with focus and optimism.

Bonus points for:

  • Strong experience with inclusive design and accessibility, ensuring that designs are usable by all.

  • Experience scaling design systems or shaping design guidelines for complex, multi-platform products.

  • Contributions to the design community. (e.g., open-source projects, speaking engagements, or published writing)

  • Familiarity with developer tools or technical domains adjacent to cybersecurity.

What you can expect:

  • Identify and define design solutions for complex and ambiguous problems—particularly in emerging AI-driven security spaces—collaborating with product and engineering to influence strategy and roadmaps through clear framing, prioritization, and customer-centric insights.

  • Lead the creation of a long-term UX vision and strategy for “AI for Security”, and “Security for AI” features, inspiring and aligning cross-functional teams around what's possible with responsible, privacy-aware AI.

  • Champion evidence-based design decisions by identifying data and research gaps, partnering with research to explore customer behaviors and expectations around AI, and translating findings into thoughtful design.

  • Explore and prototype novel AI-driven interactions to assess their viability and usability, ensuring that user value, clarity, and control remain at the center.

  • Act as a design leader and mentor, coaching designers on strategic thinking, systems-level design, and experimentation practices in AI contexts.

  • Collaborate closely with the AI workstream including product, engineering, research, and data science teams to ensure that user experience is integrated into model design and deployment decisions.

  • Advocate for ethical and inclusive AI design, ensuring our features align with our values around privacy, trust, and accessibility.

  • Operate as a culture-builder on the EDR team—sharing work in the open, shaping design team rituals, and helping others navigate ambiguity and change in a fast-moving domain.

  • Pioneer the exploration and adoption of AI design tools on the EDR team and at 1Password.

Month 1

  • Dive into our team culture, tools, design process, and workflows, gaining a solid understanding of our customers, their needs, and the broader cybersecurity landscape.

jobs.title: Strategic Finance, Director
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About 1Password

At 1Password, we’re building the foundation for a safe, productive digital future. Our mission is to unleash employee productivity without compromising security by ensuring every identity is authentic, every application sign-in is secure, and every device is trusted. We innovated the market-leading enterprise password manager and pioneered Extended Access Management, a new cybersecurity category built for the way people and AI agents work today. As one of the most loved brands in cybersecurity, we take a human-centric approach in everything from product strategy to user experience. Over 175,000 businesses and millions of people trust us to provide seamless, secure access to their most critical information. 

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

We are seeking a Strategic Finance, Director to report directly to the VP of Strategic Finance. This highly visible individual contributor role is designed for a proven leader who thrives in ambiguity, translates big-picture goals into actionable results, and elevates how finance operates in a fast-scaling environment. As the VP’s right hand, you’ll drive our finance systems roadmap, AI and automation initiatives, and cross-functional special projects—partnering across Corporate Finance, Commercial Finance, HR, and operations to enable scale, efficiency, and impact.

This is a remote opportunity within Canada and the US.

What we're looking for:

  • Proven experience – 8+ years in consulting, banking, or strategic finance roles within progressive tech companies, with a track record of driving cross-functional initiatives and creating impact—even in areas beyond your immediate expertise.

  • Builder’s mindset with curiosity – You thrive on turning ambiguity into clarity, designing scalable systems, processes, and structures, and constantly seeking smarter, more effective ways to work.

  • Influential collaborator – A trusted partner who inspires confidence, builds alignment, and energizes stakeholders to move forward together in fast-paced, high-impact environments.

  • Operational rigor & stakeholder partnership – Expert at managing complex initiatives end-to-end. You actively listen, uncover key alignment opportunities, and simplify coordination so teams work seamlessly toward shared goals.

  • Strategic translation & executive communication – Able to transform complex data and stakeholder input into clear, compelling, and actionable presentations, narratives, and dashboards that drive confident decision-making at the leadership and board level.

  • Innovation & motivation to optimize - Experience using and leading efforts to implement AI-powered applications and tooling within a Finance org, or a strong interest and capacity to ramp up quickly in this space is an asset.

What you can expect:

  • Lead the AI & automation agenda — define and execute a high-value, results-driven roadmap for AI and automation in Strategic Finance. Focus on practical, high-impact applications that drive real efficiency, accuracy, and scalability, shaping the finance function of tomorrow.

  • Streamline and elevate deliverables — optimize process for recurring reporting with automation where it adds value. Support build and refinement of presentations and narratives to ensure they are clear, polished, and exec-ready.

  • Elevate FP&A as a service — design playbooks, documentation, and self-serve resources that make finance processes transparent, empower stakeholders, and enhance collaboration across the business.

  • Lead the headcount process with clarity — streamline coordination between Finance, HR, and business leaders, ensuring roles, processes, and documentation are clear, scalable, and actionable.

  • Be the operational backbone of Strategic Finance — run the engine of team OKRs, cross-functional projects, finance-wide updates, and special initiatives.

  • Deliver accuracy with impact — own the final layer of quality control for board and executive materials, ensuring finance outputs are always accurate, clear, polished and decision-ready.

  • Partner to shape business outcomes — collaborate closely with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to directly influence the success of Strategic Finance OKRs and the company’s broader impact.

USA-based roles only: The annual base salary for this role is between $174,000 USD and $236,000 USD, plus immediate participation in 1Password's benefits program (health, dental, 401k and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

Canada-based roles only: The annual base salary for this role is between $157,000 CAD and $213,000 CAD, plus immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.

Our culture
At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results.

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to remote work
We believe in the power of remote work, but recognize that in-person connection is important to help us achieve our mission. While we are a remote-first company, travel for in-person engagement is a part of almost all roles, and we require our employees to be ready and willing to take part. Frequency will depend on role and responsibilities, and may include, but is not limited to: annual department-wide offsites, team meetings, and customer/industry events.

What we offer
We believe in working hard, and rewarding that hard work through our benefits. While not an exhaustive list, here is a glance at what we currently offer:

Health and wellbeing
👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs
🩺 Competitive health benefits
🏝 Generous PTO policy

Growth and future
📈 RSU program for most employees
💸 Retirement matching program
🔑 Free 1Password account

Community
🤝 Paid volunteer days
🏆 Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly
🌎 Remote-first work environment
*Some roles in our GTM team are currently being hired for in-person hybrid work in Toronto and Austin. These roles will specify on the posting.

You belong here.

1Password is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that is built on trust, support and respect. We welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, sex, citizenship, education, languages spoken or veteran status. Be yourself, find your people and share the things you love.

Accommodation is available upon request at any point during our recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please speak to your talent acquisition partner or email us at nextbit@agilebits.com and we’ll work to meet your needs.

Remote work is a part of our DNA. Given that our company was founded remotely in 2005, we can safely say we're experts at building remote culture. That said, remote work at 1Password does mean working from your home country. If you've got questions or concerns about this, your talent partner would be happy to address them with you.

Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check that may consist of prior employment verification, reference checks, education confirmation, criminal background, publicly available social media, credit history, or other information, as permitted by local law.

1Password uses artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies, including natural language processing and predictive analytics, to assist in the initial screening of employment applications and improve our recruitment process. See here for the latest third party bias audit information. If you prefer not to have your application assessed using AI/ML features, you may opt out by completing this form. For additional information see our Candidate Privacy Notice.

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related technical field.

  • Experience working at cybersecurity vendors in identity, PAM, passwordless, or endpoint security spaces.

Experience & Expertise

  • 8+ years of B2B SaaS product marketing experience, with at least 5 years in cybersecurity.

  • Proven track record driving go-to-market success in EMEA across multiple countries and languages.

  • Deep understanding of identity and access security (IAM, SSO, authentication, MFA, zero trust, etc.).

  • Demonstrated success supporting enterprise security solutions with complex buying cycles.

Strategic & Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Experience influencing product direction and go-to-market plans using customer and market insights.

  • Skilled in leading cross-functional teams and managing projects in a high-growth, remote-first environment.

    • Lead regional product launches and growth initiatives by tailoring global campaigns and messaging to local market needs.

Your mission is to deliver a suite of scalable, partner-centric, revenue-generating partnerships that align seamlessly with 1Password's overarching objectives.

This is a Remote opportunity within Canada and the United States.


What we're looking for:

  • Demonstrated successful experience leading the channel management activities for Managed Service Providers (MSP)

  • Extensive experience working with channel partners across MSPs, Resellers and/or distributors

  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally, offering insights and prioritizing product roadmaps to align with MSP partner requirements.

  • Ability to translate the requirements of initiatives into actionable features that can be delivered in increments

  • Proven experience leading and aligning multiple teams across sales, marketing, business development, product marketing, and customer support to execute on strategy.

  • Track record of consistently meeting and exceeding quotas

  • Over 10 years of experience in channel partner management and/or business development with at least 5 years of experience leading people.

  • Proven success hiring and developing a highly engaged and high performing team

  • Demonstrated understanding of building customer-centric partnerships from ground zero with a bias toward action.

  • Extensive experience navigating strategic and complex partnerships adeptly, facilitating co-selling with internal teams and ensuring cross-functional coordination.

  • Problem-solving mentality leveraging both internal and external resources, adept conflict resolution, and diligent follow-through with channel partners.

  • Possess a network of relationships with channel partners to aid in opportunity identification

  • Experience in Cybersecurity or SaaS industry

What you can expect:

  • Accelerate business for our partners and 1Password: Leveraging a deep understanding of global market dynamics, you will discern the needs of 1Password and our partners. Craft a comprehensive strategy that fosters win-win solutions, driving mutual revenue growth.

  • Drive operational excellence: You will Exhibit excellence by formulating strategic growth plans, compelling business cases, and partner pitches. Deliver actionable reporting while meeting deadlines and exceeding the expectations of both internal teams and partners. Simultaneously, focus on growing the partners' business.

  • Demonstrate Strong Partner Development Experience: You possess the vision to identify and drive impactful strategic partner opportunities. Demonstrate the confidence and experience to establish strategic Go-To-Market (GTM) partnerships that mutually benefit 1Password and our partners in maximizing revenue opportunities. Utilize effective communication, organizational prowess, and interpersonal skills to ensure program success.

  • Implement a Structured and Organized Approach: Display hyper-organization skills to manage multiple projects and deliverables concurrently. Navigate partner contracts, align internal processes, formulate business and financial plans, and engage cross-functional teams for program development—all activities managed with comfort and precision.

  • Lead by Example: As an adept sales professional and leader in the Go-To-Market space, you will flex between hands-on involvement and leading and coaching others as the function and team scale. Your experience serves as a guiding force in navigating the complexities of business growth.

USA-based roles only: The annual base salary for this role is between $213,000 USD and $288,000 USD plus immediate participation in 1Password's benefits program (health, dental, 401k and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

Canada-based roles only: The annual base salary for this role is between $206,000 CAD and $278,000 CAD, plus immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.

Our culture

At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.

Our approach to work

 - Curiosity & Adaptability: You are naturally curious, quick to adapt, and thrive in a dynamic environment.

 - Tech-Savvy: You are proficient with Salesforce, Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or related tools, and eager to learn new technologies.

 - Organisation & Time Management: You have strong organisation and time management skills, enabling you to juggle multiple tasks effectively


What you can expect:

 - Lead Generation: Focus primarily on generating and qualifying outbound leads, while also handling inbound inquiries through phone, email, social media, and video.

 - Manage and grow Sales Pipeline: Proactively prospect into new accounts, identifying, qualifying, and nurturing potential business opportunities in new and existing Commercial/Enterprise accounts by conducting initial conversations and following up with decision-makers.

 - X-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with Marketing, Account Executives and others to leverage their insights and expertise to achieve shared goals.

 - Develop Pipeline Generation Skills: Build and improve your skills in pipeline generation, crucial for your career progression within sales.

 - Continuous Learning: Deepen your understanding of our product, its use cases, and any company initiatives through our onboarding programme and Learning Management System. You'll also leverage resources to help you master our tech stack and understand customer challenges. You'll have ongoing support from managers through one-on-one coaching throughout.

 - Leverage Cutting-Edge Tools: Utilise an industry-leading software stack in your outbound prospecting, including Salesforce, Outreach, 6sense, Lusha, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.

 - Travel: You may occasionally be required to travel for company meetings and marketing events. The frequency and duration of travel will depend on business needs. Travel may include visits to countries where your language skills will be a valuable asset.

Our culture
At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first.

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results.

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.


Our approach to work

Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

Health and wellbeing

🏝 Generous PTO policy

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About 1Password

At 1Password, we’re building the foundation for a safe, productive digital future. Our mission is to unleash employee productivity without compromising security by ensuring every identity is authentic, every application sign-in is secure, and every device is trusted. We innovated the market-leading enterprise password manager and pioneered Extended Access Management, a new cybersecurity category built for the way people and AI agents work today. As one of the most loved brands in cybersecurity, we take a human-centric approach in everything from product strategy to user experience. Over 175,000 businesses and millions of people trust us to provide seamless, secure access to their most critical information. 

If you're excited about the opportunity to contribute to the digital safety of millions, to work alongside a team of curious, driven individuals, and to solve hard problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, then we want to hear from you. Come join us and help shape a safer, simpler digital future.

Our SMB (Small and Medium Business) Sales Team is responsible for landing and expanding 1Password customers. As an SMB Account Executive, you will be responsible for managing a territory that includes target-accounts and an existing book of business that has companies of up to 1,000 employees. Your primary focus will be on hunting new business opportunities, building sales pipeline, and driving growth within the SMB sector. You will also be responsible for upselling into the existing account base, leveraging our Extended Access Management Identity.


The successful candidate will possess exceptional skills in building and managing their own pipeline, engaging in multi-threaded relationships, and demonstrating expertise in account planning, territory management, and value-based selling.


Expectations of this role

This is designated as an in-office role. You are expected to work from 1Password’s downtown Toronto office on a full-time basis (3-5 days/week).

What we're looking for:

  • 2+ years of SaaS sales experience, with a preference for experience in the security space

  • Strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales quotas and KPIs.

  • Experience up-selling & cross-selling to both new customers and across your book of business

  • Proficiency in strategic account planning, territory management, and value-based selling.

  • Strong business acumen, communication & presentation skills to C-Suite 

  • Meticulous operating-rigor when it comes to pipeline management, forecasting and pacing to target

  • Ability to understand and articulate complex cybersecurity concepts, particularly in Identity and Access Management.

  • Self-motivated, driven, and able to work independently in a remote setting.

  • Preferable proficiency with Salesforce, Slack, Zoom, Linkedin Sales Navigator & Outreach

What you can expect:

  • Sales:

    • Own your territory and build and Maintain Pipeline: Develop a strong sales pipeline through proactive prospecting, cold calling, and networking.

  • Drive Sales Growth: 

    • Achieve or exceed sales targets and KPIs, including:

    • Consistently meet or exceed quarterly sales quotas.

    • Maintain a high level of outbound activity, including calls, emails, and meetings.

    • Develop and close new business opportunities within your territory.

    • Upsell and Expand Accounts: Identify opportunities to upsell Extended Access Management to your Enterprise Password Manager Customers.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration/Team Selling:

    • Collaborate seamlessly with SDRs, Solutions, Onboarding and Customer Success Managers (CSM) to optimize client engagement and identify growth opportunities.

    • Engage in multi-threaded relationships within client organizations to enhance overall account health.

  • Value-Based Selling:

    • Implement value-based selling strategies to align our solutions with client needs and objectives.

    • Demonstrate a deep understanding of client pain points and position our offerings as strategic solutions.

  • Presentation and Negotiation:

    • Confidently present to C-suite executives, articulating the value proposition of our products and services.

    • Experience working with Mutual Action Plans to drive an agreed-upon outcome.

    • Utilize strong negotiation skills to drive mutually beneficial outcomes.

Canada-based roles only: The annual base salary for this role is between $66,000 CAD and $90,000 CAD and is commission-eligible. The role is also eligible for immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.


Our culture 

At 1Password, we prioritize collaboration, clear and transparent communication, receptiveness to feedback, and alignment with our core values: keep it simple, lead with honesty, and put people first. 

You’ll be part of a team that challenges the status quo, and is excited to experiment and iterate in search of the best solution. That said, 1Password is not for everyone. Our work is demanding, we strive for excellence, and the pace is fast. We need people who are keen to take on challenging problems, who seek feedback to grow, and who are driven to make an impact. If you're looking for a place where you can settle into a comfortable routine, this might not be the right fit for you. We’re looking for individuals who are proven experts in their fields, as well as those who are highly adaptable, can thrive in ambiguity and through change, are curious, and above all deliver results. 

We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology—including AI—to achieve our mission. We also understand that thinking critically about AI in its current forms will help us create better solutions for our customers and ourselves with its future forms, which will help us continue to close the gap between security and privacy and achieve our mission. We want team members at all levels to take the approach of actively learning AI best practices, identifying opportunities to apply AI in meaningful ways, and driving innovative solutions in their daily work. Embracing the future of AI isn't just encouraged at 1Password—it's an essential part of how we will be successful at 1Password.


Our approach to work

We recognize the power of both in person collaboration and remote work. Some roles are designated as remote-first, with an expectation that individuals work from their homes majority of the time, while others are designated as in-office roles, with an expectation of being on-site on a regular basis. We recognize that certain roles benefit from regular, in-person connection to support collaboration, team cohesion, and customer engagement.

For all roles, occasional travel may be required. This includes things like: department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events are typically held in varying locations across Canada, USA and/or EMEA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average.

Note: All go-to market roles will have an in-person onboarding in Toronto.

What we offer

We believe in working hard, and rewarding that hard work through our benefits. While not an exhaustive list, here is a glance at what we currently offer: 

Health and wellbeing

👶 Maternity and parental leave top-up programs

🏝 Generous PTO policy 

💖 Four company-wide wellness days 

 Growth and future 

📈 Company equity for all full-time employees

💸 Retirement matching program

🔑 Free 1Password account

Community 

🤝 Paid volunteer days 

🌎 Employee-led inclusion and belonging programs and ERGs

🏆 Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly

You belong here.

1Password is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that is built on trust, support and respect. We welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, sex, citizenship, education, languages spoken or veteran status. Be yourself, find your people and share the things you love.

Accommodation is available upon request at any point during our recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please speak to your talent acquisition partner or email us at nextbit@agilebits.com and we’ll work to meet your needs.

Remote work is a part of our DNA. Given that our company was founded remotely in 2005, we can safely say we're experts at building remote culture. That said, remote work at 1Password does mean working from your home country. If you've got questions or concerns about this, your talent partner would be happy to address them with you.

Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check that may consist of prior employment verification, reference checks, education confirmation, criminal background, publicly available social media, credit history, or other information, as permitted by local law.

See here for the latest third party bias audit information. If you prefer not to have your application assessed using AI/ML features, you may opt out by completing this form. For additional information see our Candidate Privacy Notice.

We’re building the next generation of identity infrastructure—centralized, secure, and privacy-first.   • Hands-on technical depth: Able to “speak the language” of your team, guiding architecture design and overall technical direction

  • People-centric leadership: The ability to create and maintain a positive, healthy team environment in which everyone is supported, encouraged, and meaningfully challenged to do great work.   • Growth environment: Thrive in a fast-paced, ambitious organization that values honesty, security, and clarity in communication.

    • Join a privacy-first culture that empowers engineers through clear, inclusive leadership.

    • Collaborate with a cross-functional, expert team building mission-critical identity systems.

    • Solve tough challenges—like balancing encryption, usability, and centralization in identity workflows.

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with federation protocols (OIDC, SAML, SCIM, OAuth2).

  • Background in zero trust architectures or cryptographically enforced data policies.

  • Previous roles launching enterprise-grade IAM or encryption-first systems.

Lead device security program, responsible for the development of security libraries and frameworks to support product feature development, security vulnerability remediation and minimization. Oversee security standards initiatives and critical security product features.

Represent Product Security in executive and board-level discussions, providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
